titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Music Department Sheet music collection, 1827-1900 MS2136
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-11 11:39:47 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: George Washington University. Dept. of Music

did.abstract: Collection contains bound volumes of sheet music. These twelve items cover the years 1827-1900. The music includes piano and guitar pieces as well as music in French, Italian, English, and Spanish.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Music Department Sheet music collection, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items were a gift of The George Washington University Music Department in 1994.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains bound volumes of sheet music. These twelve items cover the years 1827-1900. The music includes piano and guitar pieces as well as music in French, Italian, English, and Spanish.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume of numerous works, including: Beware! / words by H.W. Longfellow ; composed by James Ernest Perring -- [several songs by Virginia Gabriel] -- When nobody's nigh to hear : ballad / words, Jean Inglow ; music Fanny C. Shellman -- The battle field : fantasie brillante for the piano forte / dedicated to Gen. R.E. Lee by S.A. Strother -- Golden bells : caprice de concert / by Sydney Smith -- O hush thee my baby : quartet / by Arthur S. Sullivan. Carrie Brockett was the collector of this volume. Formerly Ind. Ms. Bd. 99 f

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume of 19 works, including: Marguerite / composed for the piano by James Ernest Perring -- Dreams of remembrance : a collection of beautiful songs -- Popular German songs with English and German words -- The bridge / written by H.W. Longfellow ; music composed by M. Lindsay -- Answer : ballad / composed by A.G. Robyn -- Ruby : song / by Virginia Gabriel. Maggie Crumrine collected this volume. Formerly Ind. Ms. Bd. 98 f

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume containing 22 titles, including: Ellsworth requiem / George William Warren -- Pearls & diamonds : 12 melodies for the piano / by favorite composers -- The little gipsey : mazurka / George William Warren -- La scintilla mazurka / L.M. Gottschalk -- Remember me / Auguste Held -- Garibaldi's Sicilian march / H.N. Hempsted -- Cobweb tarentella / George William Warren. Annie Matilda Colt was the collector of this volume. Formerly Ind. Ms. Bd. 92 f

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume containing about 40 titles, including: The May Queen / poetry by Alfred Tennyson ; music by William R. Dempster -- Moore's melodies. Number 1 / Thomas Moore -- My mountain home / poetry by Samuel Lover ; music by William J. Wetmore -- Variations sur la marche favorite de l'opera de Bellini, la Norma / composee´s pour le piano forte par F. Hunten -- Selections from Fry's grand opera Leonora. Pt. I -- The snow storm, a ballad / the words by Seba Smith ; music by L. Heath ; arranged for the piano forte by George Hews -- [several polkas and waltzes]. Mrs. H. D. Cooke was the collector of this volume. Formerly Ind. Ms. Bd. 93 f

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume of numerous works, in English, French, Italian, and Spanish. Julia Clark Jesup was the collector of this volume. Formerly Ind Ms. Bd. 100 f

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume containing 30 titles, including: The last hope / L.M. Gottschalk -- The hundredth Psalm / transcribed for the piano forte by Wm. Vincent Wallace -- The banjo / L.M. Gottschalk -- Lotta's favorite waltz / Charles Kinkel -- Mendelssohns wedding march for two pianos / arranged expressly for the use of schools by A.W. Berg -- [several collections of favorite piano pieces]. Mary W. Nairn was the collector of this scrapbook. Formerly #94 f

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume containing numerous works, including: Sonate / W.A. Mozart -- The Japanese polka / by Gaston de Lille -- Diamond polka / composed by E. Szemele´nyi -- The swinging Schottisch / by Augustus Cull -- Oliver gallop / Tom, the blind Negro boy pianst -- Danse ne`gre / J. Ascher -- Plantation dance, burlesque / by J.N. Pattison -- Funeral march, to the memory of Abraham Lincoln / music by Mrs. E.A. Parkhurst. Titles and words in English, German, French and Italian. William Soule Stickney was the collector of this scrapbook. Formerly Ind Ms. Bd. 103 f

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume of numerous works, including: Jenny Lind's greeting to America -- New edition of Jenny Linds songs [We live mid the bounding] -- Gems of Madame Anna Bishop's concerts -- Songs of Madame Bishop / edited by N.C. Bochsa -- Little Red Riding Hood / words by Charles Jefferys ; music by Stephen Glover -- The blind boy / poetry by Hannah F. Gould ; music by William Dempster -- The cadets graduating song / words by a lady of the army ; music by a cadet -- Graduating song, class of 1855, West Point. Lizzie Wheeler was the collector of this volume. Formerly Ind. Ms. Bd. 97 f

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume containing numerous works, especially waltzes and marches, including: Works for the pianoforte / Fre´de´ric Chopin -- Famous marches arranged for the piano -- The liberty bell march / by John Philip Sousa -- El capitan march / by John Philip Sousa -- The stars and stripes forever march / by John Philip Sousa. Some titles in French and Italian. Nannette Wurzburger was the collector of this volume. Formerly Ind Ms. Bd. 101 f

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume containing numerous works, including: The lake of Como / G.A. Hodson -- collection of favorite songs arranged for the Spanish guitar / P.K. Moran -- New and improved method for the Spanish guitar / composed & arranged by Otto Torp -- [other pieces for the Spanish guitar]. Formerly Ind Ms. Bd. 95 f

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume of 20 works, including: Study with amusement : a series of progressive lessons / Franz Petersilea - instructions and progressive exercises in the art of singing / D. Crivelli -- The parlour quadrilles / Edward L. White -- Lucrezia Borgia Waltz / arranged by William C. Glynn -- Howard's quick step / Frank Howard -- Music of the original Christy Minstrels [Oh! Susanna! only] -- Grande sonate pathe´tique pour le piano forte / par Louis van Beethoven. Formerly Ind Ms. Bd. 96 f

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volume of numerous works including: Don not turn me from your door / words and music by Will. S. Hays -- Sweet by and by / by J.P. Webster -- The heart bowed down / M.W. Balfe -- Embarrassment / by Frantz Abt -- Home sweet home / Henry R. Bishop -- Whispering hope / Alice Hawthorne -- Silver threads among the gold / words by Eben E. Rexford ; music by H.P. Danks -- See that my grave is kept green / song and chorus written and composed by Gus. Williams -- Perished in the snow / words and music by Eddie Fox -- Close the shutters, Willie's dead! / words and music by Jas. E. Stewart. Formerly Ind Ms. Bd. 101 f
